net.ant.rc.serial

Class SerialCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.ant.rc.serial.SerialCommunicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class SerialCommunicator
extends java.lang.Object
implements gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener
    This class is SerialPort listener.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ant

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SerialCommunicator(SerialConnection serialConnection)
      Not useful from applications.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void initListener()
      Runs SerialPort event listener.
      java.lang.String sendCommand(java.lang.String command)
      Sends text through the SerialPort and waits for the answer
      void serialEvent(gnu.io.SerialPortEvent serialPortEvent)
      Invokes outside the application by SerialPort event.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SerialCommunicator

        public SerialCommunicator(SerialConnection serialConnection)
        Not useful from applications. It initiates by SerialDriver. You don't need to worry about it in application.

    • Method Detail

      • initListener

        public void initListener()
                  throws java.util.TooManyListenersException
        Runs SerialPort event listener. If event appears, it notifies the serialEvent method.
        Throws:
        java.util.TooManyListenersException

      • serialEvent

        public void serialEvent(gnu.io.SerialPortEvent serialPortEvent)
        Invokes outside the application by SerialPort event. It require the listener is up.
        Specified by:
        serialEvent in interface gnu.io.SerialPortEventListener
        See Also:
        initListener()

      • sendCommand

        public java.lang.String sendCommand(java.lang.String command)
                             throws CommPortException
        Sends text through the SerialPort and waits for the answer
        Parameters:
        command - Text to send
        Returns:
        Firmware answer text
        Throws:
        CommPortException
